intro: Sonchus angulatus, commonly known as angular sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with serrated, angular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a single head, surrounded by bracts. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be an invasive species in some regions.
